definition: radical of a compound word (in European language)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: The prefix, etyma and suffix have been embedded inside.
sentences.chinese: 前後綴及詞根已被包含。

sentences.english: This is where the word roots emerged in ancient Greek.
sentences.chinese: 這個詞根這樣出現在古希臘語裏。

sentences.english: Many English words have Latin roots.
sentences.chinese: 很多英語單詞都有拉丁詞根。

sentences.english: This word is a derivative. Can you point out its root?
sentences.chinese: 這是個派生詞，你能指出它的詞根嗎？

sentences.english: As well as that, there are several derivatives that can be formed from root words.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，有很多衍生詞可以從詞根獲得。

sentences.english: The root structure of the semitic languages.
Long before English was English the roots of this word were likely Germanic.
sentences.chinese: 在英語還未成形之前，這個詞的詞根可能源於德語。

sentences.english: The Indo-European root that likely gave us our word number was nem.
sentences.chinese: number這個詞的印歐語詞根可能是nem。

sentences.english: Utilize root to add prefixes or the suffix and form neologisms .
sentences.chinese: 利用詞根加前綴或後綴構成新詞。

sentences.english: But the word root goes back to Indo-European.
sentences.chinese: 不過，人們得把它的詞根追溯到印歐語系了。

sentences.english: With the root of this word, take a guess. What is the meaning of this word?
sentences.chinese: 憑據詞根猜一猜這個複詞的意念是甚麼？

sentences.english: By some estimates, 65% of all English words have Latin roots.
sentences.chinese: 據估計，65%的英語單詞包含拉丁詞根。

definition: to transliterate/to transcribe/to transfer words onto a surface by direct contact (as with a decal)
